alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Dallas; Lowndes; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 1:31AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Autauga, central Lowndes, southern Dallas and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 131 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mulberry to 7 miles west of Dannelly Reservoir. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Montgomery, Prattville, Selma, Mosses, Hayneville, Selmont-West Selmont, Autaugaville, White Hall, Gordonville, Lowndesboro, Benton, Booth, Vida Junction, Gardner Island, Tyler, Autauga County Airport, Old Cahaba Park, Maxwell Air Force Base, Dannelly Reservoir and Mulberry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for central, south central and east central Alabama.
